alert.note: Alert for Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 31 at 2:27AM PST until February 02 at 6:00AM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 AM THURSDAY TO 6 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Snowfall of 2 to 6 inches from 6000 to 7000 feet, 6 to 12 inches from 7000 to 8000 feet, and 12 to 24 inches above 8000 feet. * WHERE...Mountains of San Bernardino and Riverside Counties above 6000 feet. * WHEN...From 4 AM Thursday to 6 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The snow level will rise to 7000 to 7500 feet on Thursday morning, then fall during the afternoon to around 5000 feet Thursday night.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Riverside County Mountains; San Bernardino County Mountains
